phrase.item: In a small village there lived a man.
He had a very good heart. From up and down [the street] travellers came to his house, he gave them water and breakfast, and let them leave.
One day, two horsemen came near his house and one asked his friend, "Where we should have breakfast?"
His friend replied, "We are going to the loser's house."
The man was on top of his roof sewing his shoe and heard them saying those things.
The horsemen entered the house; they wanted to eat something and leave.
They entered and sat for a while, but there wasn't anyone there.
The man coughed on his roof, and they saw that he was on his roof.
They said, "We are travelers; come down, give us something and we will leave."
The man replied, "I am not going to be a loser."
They were left there cold [with no one taking care of them] and they left unwillingly.
